column4: can anyone please help me? Ubuntu doesn't recognize my TV card! :(
that means that there is solution, right? :S
no, I'm saying that support for TV cards is weak at best
are you sure that it is a supported model? what is the chipset?
but it used to work! Chipset is SAA7131
hmm, have you tried to manually modprobe the modules?
yes. I've tried modprobe saa7134 card=65 tuner=54, no success
the problem is that LSPCI does NOT list my card...
because LSPCI should show ALL PCI cards whether or not they are supported
maybe you have a dead card, sometimes they break
one Q: if I have SAA7131 Philips chipset, do I have to use BTTV or no?
sorry, I'm not familiar with the chipset
never remove those things with power on, you can seriously damage them

* unless you're ultra geeky and have figured out how to control power and signal to them with fancy BIOS and kernel stuff (I know some servers can hot-swap PCI cards, but your computer isn't one of them)
